subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Acid Pro
author: Cheri Esperon
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01AA_01C8E2CC.61A97380
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Sony Sound Forge is the audio program you are probably thinking of..   As f=
ar as cool edit- Adobe owns it now.. now it is called Adobe Audition.  I ha=
ve used all 3 and by far prefer Auditon..  but I am an Adobe snob and tend =
to prefer all Adobe products.


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Sak=
litaboth 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, July 10, 2008 8:=
30 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Acid Pro


        I have sony acid pro 6, I=
 use it for loop creation for a website Im working on currently and for a t=
rack for a animated video Im doing for the intro to my site (that Im doing =
in 3d studio max 9). As far as I can tell sony acid pro is really not a pro=
gram you'd want to use for evp related things, I mean you can but you are o=
ver complicating what you want to be doing. What I use for evp's is cool ed=
it pro. I dont believe the new company that took it over calls it cool edit=
 pro any longer but, I use the older version because it works great for evp=
's, so if you google it you can find it no problem, it makes it easier to s=
trip out ambient noise (like white noise) while leaving the voices complete=
ly entact. its basically like diving deeper and deeper into the sound and i=
t works great for it. Regards,

                                           =
                                             T.L.

        --- On Tue, 7/8/=
08, Zack Widup <w9sz@...> wrote:


          From: Zack Widup <w=
9sz@...>
          Subject: [EVP-ITC] Acid Pro
          To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com
          Date: Tuesday, July 8, 2008, 11:16 AM


Yep =
- here it is:

http://www.sonycreativesoftware.com/acidpro

I think I'll tr=
y the free demo.

Zack


On Tue, 8 Jul 2008, threadsintyme@... wrote:
=

> Any ideas as to where to find this program?
> Al
>
> -- Zack Widup <w9sz=
@...> wrote:
>
>
> You could do that with a program called Acid,=
 but I don't have it.
>
> Zack
>
> On Tue, 8 Jul 2008, threadsintyme@juno.c=
om wrote:
>
>> Is there any way to slow this down and then change the pitch=
 to be
able to hear the full message? Any software that might help?
>> Al
>=
